column4: how do i get the source from the same ffmpeg version i have installed trough apt-get ?
if you have the deb-src sources use apt-get source package
lol i dunno what deb-src sources are
you mean i don't have just the directory on my system :s:s:s
that was your answer to the question where it puts the sources right?
your moba has two chipsets the VIA and a promise one both supported by linux afaik. if you configured a raid volume trough bios you have to check if dmraid support your conf to access the volume
what do you think of that howto?
thats the one i was looking for ;) if you already created a raid volume through Bios or from windows with asus utilities you will need dmraid to access the volume from linux
ok thanx, i'm not sure i'm just asking for a friend i'm at, he wants to intall ubuntu but wasnt sure about raid support for his controller
if he wants to use the raid only in linux it is better to not use fakeraid and use software raid
no he wants multiboot with xp (he didnt like vista :p)
i mean he's replacing vista with ubuntu :p
world domination at our hands at last ;P
anyway thanx for the fast help, i'm out :-)
